title: joreas
author: joreas
content: 15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.https://twitter.com/joreball/status/1692428160846200953/photo/1

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: QuoteIT'S BITCOIN.ORG 15 YEARS ANNIVERSARY AND NO ONE IS CELEBRATINGMaybe because this forum is bitcointalk.org and not bitcoin.org? Even if both were created by Satoshi himself.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.I don't think that anyone still cares a lot about the anniversary of that site and that's why no one is celebrating its anniversary. Like @Poker Player said that the forum is bitcointalk.org not bitcoin.org and that's a valid reason for the members of the forum to not celebrate 15 years anniversary of that site. I also believe that the site is very important in we go back in the early days of Bitcoin, but now a days no one is that much interested in celebrating its anniversary. I hope you got your answer and if you are satisfied with your answer then kindly lock this thread.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: I think people who love Bitcoin is more focused on the coming halving than the anniversary of the registration of the Bitcoin domain which officially starts the name Bitcoin "legally" for the whole world to see and experience. It is ironic to note that this day BTC and many altcoins are experiencing some red days. Anyway, celebration can come in many ways...just remembering the day is one of them. I am just wondering who or what organization is now controlling the domain name of Bitcoin....?

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: I see it as something people value what they are having and using than what had been into existence one upon a time, bitcoin.org may be the first in place but look at what we have today which is bitcointalk.org what the people have in mind mostly is this present platform and to cap it all, not all members even have the idea of the first existing platform except those that have dive into knowing more about bitcoin history and those who started early together with the platform.

comments.author: Uruhara
comments.body: Quote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.Even though it is not celebrated, this historic day deserves to be remembered and commemorated. Because after all it was part of the history of bitcoin in the early days. Looks like today I got a lot of new insights about bitcoin. In another topic I got insight from a topic someone made (What they used before Blockchain Explorer?). And now I'm getting new insights and insights that I think are important in the bitcoin history book. Thank you friends for sharing things that many people forget. I haven't forgotten it but I did find out about it today.

comments.author: peter0425
comments.body: Quote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.You can celebrate in Bitcoin.org but this is Bitcointalk.org mate and there isalso a day of celebration here.but OK Happy Bitcoin.org anniversary even if I really have no idea what this site is all about.Quote from: Uruhara on August 18, 2023, 09:28:56 AMQuote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.Even though it is not celebrated, this historic day deserves to be remembered and commemorated. Because after all it was part of the history of bitcoin in the early days. Looks like today I got a lot of new insights about bitcoin. In another topic I got insight from a topic someone made (What they used before Blockchain Explorer?). And now I'm getting new insights and insights that I think are important in the bitcoin history book. Thank you friends for sharing things that many people forget. I haven't forgotten it but I did find out about it today. well , you are correct on that part because maybe if there is no Bitcoin.org . maybe satoshi will not come to idea creating bitcointalk.org as it is all connected

comments.author: icalical
comments.body: It don't surprise me that people won't remember the date when the domain is registered, people are more focusing on the product which is Bitcoin, so the launched of Bitcoin, January 2009 is more remembered by people, and that's fair, I didn't say that the domain registration date is not important, but the product launch is definitely more important.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Quote from: SamReomo on August 18, 2023, 08:59:17 AMQuote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.I don't think that anyone still cares a lot about the anniversary of that site and that's why no one is celebrating its anniversary. Like @Poker Player said that the forum is bitcointalk.org not bitcoin.org and that's a valid reason for the members of the forum to not celebrate 15 years anniversary of that site. I also believe that the site is very important in we go back in the early days of Bitcoin, but now a days no one is that much interested in celebrating its anniversary. I hope you got your answer and if you are satisfied with your answer then kindly lock this thread.I do not think that might be the case as I feel the community is more into celebrating the reason why Bitcoin become famous. Another reason I believe that most community members are active on the forum than the website. Though Bitcoin.org is the only website where you can read the whitepaper in different languages which according to me is a big achievement.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Sometimes I forget about this but since there are no congratulatory responses means they dont acknowledged the anniversary of the domain. Obviously none cause we are in the forum. I even think the pizza event or historical details are much important or familiar by community than this one.But is there any official celebration for bitcoin which was recognized by a lot of community and users?

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: I am not sure why you want us to celebrate a domain registration and those who are tweeting this out are surely doing it for their own benefit, I don't see any of it for you or me.I would be happy to celebrate if I get to know who satoshi is instead of this, not a big deal for me and shouldn't be for anyone around the community.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.Well, not everything that appears important really matters most of the time; it might matter to some, and to some it might not add any value, and celebrating just a dominance registered date won't add anything to the bearish market that we are about to face in the bitcoin market, or will I say that we are already on?It's obvious the guy who made that tweet is just looking for a way to get noticed, as it was clear with his statement, as he probably dumped some bitcoin in order to get noticed.Either way, it's good that there are historical records that are well kept and will be remembered someday, even if they're not celebrated as expected. We individually add value and meaning to whatever we want, so that shouldn't be a problem. You can also celebrate it from your end if you want.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, did you decide to create this topic today for the first time in such a long period of time? Open the secret: what do you have to do with this event that you were so affected by the inattention of the forum to such a great date in your opinion? Where were you all the other time?

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: So, you're using the forum to try to gain a few views on your Twitter account?This is quite low, and borderline pathetic.Quote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.Yeah, newsflash!The Bitcoin word was entered far earlier since bitcoin(dot)com was first registered in 2003!

comments.author: DooMAD
comments.body: There are many dates people seem to want to celebrate.  One could argue there might be too many of them.  People want to commemorate the anniversary of the whitepaper, the genesis block, bitcointalk.org, bitcoin.org, "that pizza", etc.  I'm far too lazy to celebrate that many things every year.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Uruhara on August 18, 2023, 09:28:56 AMEven though it is not celebrated, this historic day deserves to be remembered and commemorated. Because after all it was part of the history of bitcoin in the early days. Looks like today I got a lot of new insights about bitcoin. In another topic I got insight from a topic someone made (What they used before Blockchain Explorer?). And now I'm getting new insights and insights that I think are important in the bitcoin history book. Thank you friends for sharing things that many people forget. I haven't forgotten it but I did find out about it today. Same feelings dear mate, That information was also new to me and this was also a new set of information but tbh i am bad at remembering dates so the chances of forgetting this information next year are so high. But still i would try to celebrate it next year. And then i will try to mention this OP to invite in that celebration. Bitcoin.ORG was the domain name of BTC website while this forum is known as Bitcointalk. Both are although two different names but are made for the same purpose of BTC. So, i think it really deserved a chance of celebration and to celebrate we could donate to this domain if there is any donation address.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Quote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.Something is wrong with Op's post or I am getting it wrong because I think Op should at least know the difference between Bitcoin.org and Bitcointalk.org. So OP I think you need to have a look again on your topic because Bitcoin.org is a hardware store and provides other information related to Bitcoin as communities, and other types of Guides etc etc. I had never seen a dedicated topic for the Bitcoin.org Aniversday. If OP is confused with both then he should at least go for a quick go through if not I'm not sure Why because we even do celebrate different events as Pizza Day. Legal tender day upcoming infinity day etc.

comments.author: panganib999
comments.body: A lot of these are more of ceremonial celebrations and not religious or ritualistic, which means that whether we make a big deal out of it or not doesn't necessarily equate to us losing track of what bitcoin is. I'd argue that the fact that the industry is able to move on from mundane stuff like this is a great enough sign that we're progressing and developing at a breakneck pace, which is good for everyone involved, whether you're a builder or an investor. Of course it's great every now and then to reminisce about the simpler times, but between then and now where bitcoin is significantly more valuable, I'd choose today. It's one thing to recall and reminisce, it's another to look back and retain past habits just cause.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: joreas on August 18, 2023, 07:06:25 AM15 years ago today, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi entered the word BITCOIN into the annals of world history through the registration of the domain name BITCOIN.ORG.Many people who have bitcoins do not have an idea about this date and do not care about it, I on my own do not see any reason why an investor in bitcoins should have this date in their head when it is not something that can increase the bitcoins they have. People who have bitcoins are more interested in getting more that marking a historic date. If you know about the date, you can personally have your celebrations, there is no need to make a big deal from it. There are better things that can be celebrated about bitcoins and we hope to celebrate acceptance and adoption of bitcoins above everything else.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Attention economy prospering + people having their own stuff to deal with... it makes sense if they don't have the energy to celebrate every little thing. I tried to access bitcoin.org and even them don't appear to be celebrating as well -- so there's that.In any case, I'd say it's best to just let people do whatever they want on this, it's not like there's a wrong answer.
